snippet.title: World Cup goes to football-mad Porto Alegre
snippet.description: Porto Alegre is one of the most tradition-rich football cities in Brazil, providing the perfect background for World Cup matches.

snippet.title: World Cup goes to football-mad Porto Alegre
snippet.description: Porto Alegre is one of the most tradition-rich football cities in Brazil, providing the perfect background for World Cup matches.

snippet.title: Champions semis: Madrid-Bayern, Atletico-Chelsea
snippet.description: Real Madrid will play defending champion Bayern Munich in the Champions League semifinals, and Atletico Madrid will face Chelsea.

snippet.title: Valencia fights back from 3-0 down to win 5-3
snippet.description: Valencia fought back from a three-goal, first-leg deficit Thursday to beat Basel 5-0 and qualify for the Europa League semifinal, while competition favorite Juventus advanced after a tense 2-1 win at home to Lyon.

snippet.title: Suarez aims to match previous success at World Cup
snippet.description: Luis Fernando Suarez made history when he guided Ecuador to the round of 16 at the 2006 World Cup, and the Colombian has already achieved considerable success with Honduras just by qualifying for this year's tournament.

snippet.title: Honduras looking for a few upsets at World Cup
snippet.description: Looking for its first win in its third World Cup, Honduras coach Luis Fernando Suarez is ready to spring a surprise in Brazil.

snippet.title: 'Engineer' finds blueprint for Greek success
snippet.description: Known as the "Engineer" in his native Portugal for his university education and careful planning, Fernando Santos has lived up to that reputation in Greece since taking over as coach of the national football team.

snippet.title: 5 Colombia players to watch at the World Cup
snippet.description: Colombia is still hoping it will be able to count on striker Radamel Falcao when it plays in the World Cup for the first time in 16 years.

snippet.title: Chelsea, Real Madrid reach Champions League semis
snippet.description: A boyhood fan of Paris Saint-Germain, Demba Ba showed any lingering affection he has for the club is in the past.
